newsitem.title: UK: Laura Ashley up on bargain hunting.
newsitem.headline: Laura Ashley up on bargain hunting.

text.p: Shares in British clothing and furnishings retailer Laura Ashley Plc gained over six percent on Tuesday in what dealers described as bargain hunting.
Laura Ashley shares were trading at 204-1/2p by 1026 GMT, up 12-1/2p on the day. Over 300,000 stocks had changed hands.
"The stocks came off sharply last month and we thought that was a bit overdone. We noticed some interest last night and that seems to have accelerated," one marketmaker said.
The shares dropped over 20 percent in late September when the retailer announced lower-than-expected profits.
